atom.desc: Able to define atom and a molecule

fma.desc: The relationship between force, mass, and acceleration

lewis_dot.desc: Able to create of the Lewis Dot Structure models.

bonds.desc: Define polar, non-polar, and covalent bonds.

molecules.desc: be able to define a molecule

systems.desc: Able to define a system, open/closed systems, and isolated systems

acc.desc: Able to calculate and define acceleration

force.desc: Able to calculate and define force

newton_meters.desc: Relationship between Newtons, newton meters, and joules

energy-forms.desc: An overview of different forms of energy

work.desc: Define work as the process of a change in energy and calculate its units relative to energy

chem_energy.desc: Intro to chemical energy and calories. Relates to chem_reations

kinetic_energy.desc: Able to define and use the formula to calculate kinetic energy of some object

grav_pot_energy.desc: Able to calculate and define gravitation potential energy, specifically on earth

conservation_energy.desc: the amount of energy is constant, just changes forms

work_energy_theorem.desc: Able to relate work and energy

atomic-weight.desc: Define atomic weight (average mass of all atoms of that element)

read-periodic.desc: Be able to read the basic facts from a periodic table

atomic-number.desc: Define atomic number, importance in isotopes, and locate it on an element on the periodic table

chemical-symbols.desc: Be able to write simple chemical symbols.

energy_heat_trans.desc: Understand how much energy is used in a heat transfer, and what factors it depends on

biases.desc: Understand types and influences of biases

greek-alpha.desc: Understand and notetate basic greek letters in capital and lowercase

stats_sample.desc: Identify what a sample is in statistics

stats_mean.desc: Define what a mean is in statistics

stats-histogram.desc: Construct a histogram based on a set of date

coulomb_amps.desc: Understand the connection between coulumbs and amps

dc.desc: Define the basics of a direct current

watts.desc: Define watts, note other equivalent units

resistors-series.desc: Define what it means for components to be in series

law-kirchhoff.desc: Understand Kirchhoff's Voltage and Current Laws

resistors-parallel.desc: Define what it means for components to be in parallel

charge.desc: Be able to define and understand the concept of charge

fertilizer.desc: Understand how fertilizer works and grows plants

concrete.desc: Understand the process of concrete development

metals.desc: Define and understand a metal in depth

angle.desc: Define and understand what angles are

rad.desc: Understand the unit radians and convert to degrees

types-angle.desc: Define obtuse, acute, supplementary, and complementary angles

triangle.desc: Understand the properties of a triangle

types-triangle.desc: Understand the types of a triangle: equilateral, isosceles, scalene

pythagorean_theorem.desc: Understand and use the pythagorean theorem

hypotenuse.desc: Identify the hypotenuse of a triangle

distance_formula.desc: Understand the basics of the distance formula using the hypotenuse

congruence.desc: Understand the types of triangle congruence

circles.desc: Understand circles, their area, radius vs diameter, circumferences + area

sector.desc: Define a sector in context of a circle

tangent.desc: Define tangent in terms of a circle

math-function.desc: Understand and define a function, and its domains/ranges. Differentiate from relations

math-variable.desc: Understand and define a variable in terms of graphing and functions

math-graph.desc: Understand and define a graph. Using desmos as a graphing simulator.

math-inverse_func.desc: Understand the conversion between functions and their inverses.

volume-solids.desc: Calculate the volume of different solids, including pyramids, cylinders, spheres, and unique shapes

conic-sections.desc: Understand and calculate, and graph conic sections

manufacturing_methods.desc: Understand various manufacturing methods and their benefits/drawbacks

intro_integration.desc: Basics of integration using physics concepts

calc_velocity.desc: Calculating velocity given acceleration and initial velocity

calc_accel.desc: Calculating position given given a graph

air_resistance.desc: Define air resistance (the video is a very good explanation)

free_fall.desc: Understand free fall as a force concept

distance_displacement.desc: Understand the distance between distance vs displacement

projectile_motion.desc: Understand projectile motion and independence of motion

solving_quadratics.desc: Understanding how to solve quadratic equations

quadratic_formula.desc: Apply the quadratic formula to find the roots of the equation

vectors.desc: Understand a vector and its properties in depth

vector_add_sub.desc: Able to do vector addition and subtraction

consv_momentum.desc: Understand collisions and conservation of momentum

dot_product.desc: Understand and multiply vectors using the dot product

boat_terminology.desc: Define a boat's hull, port, deck, starboard,bow, stern, and methods of motion

rudder.desc: Understand and define the use of a rudder

sails.desc: Understand how sails work, attributes of the wind force and how wind pressure works

pitch-yaw-roll.desc: Define pitch yaw and roll as the 3 axes of rotation

fbd.desc: Be able to understand, interpret, and draw free body diagrams. Review all digital resources videos!

exponential_growth.desc: Calculate exponential growth and understand exponents

bar_chart.desc: Be able to graph and interpret a bar chart

line_graph.desc: Be able to graph and interpret a line graph

pie_chart.desc: Be able to graph and interpret a pie chart

scatterplot.desc: Be able to graph and interpret a scatterplot

dataviz.desc: Be able to understand graphs and data distributions

siphon.desc: Understand how a siphon works, and how it works in a toilet

half-life.desc: Understand the concept of a half life

log_properties.desc: Understand how to use logarithm properties

sine.desc: Introduction to the sine function and its graph

cosine.desc: Introduction to the cosine function and its graph

trig_derivatives.desc: Understand how to derive and use trig derivative functions, specifically with sin and cosine

trig_functions.desc: Understand the relationships with all of the trig functions

trig_integrals.desc: Understand the area under the curve as a trig integral, and integrate the trig functions

inverse_trig.desc: Understand and calculate all inverse trig functions

sum_diff_formulas.desc: Understand use of sum and difference formulas

double_half_angle_ids.desc: Understand use of double angle and half angle identities
